definition:
Let $X$ be a submodule of a module $Y$. We say that $X$ is an
[*essential submodule*]{} of $Y$, and that $Y$ is an [*essential
extension*]{} of $X$, if whenever $A$ is a nonzero submodule of $Y$,
then $A \cap X$ is also nonzero.

A monomorphism $f : X \to Y$ is an [*essential monomorphism*]{} if the
image ${\rm im} f$ is an essential submodule of $Y$.
